content.raw:
This functionality is used "all the time" here at NIST/JQI.  The problem it solves is that for max stability we never ever stop the experiment from cycling, but you generally don't want to repeat a batch of shots, just the last one that keeps the system warm and in a default state.

For the GUI: I don't favor an approach that adds clutter to the interface.  

* A different solution would be to have a check button like it is, repeat or not repeat, but on right click you have the option of selecting what the type of "repeat" occurs.  This would use the same context menu that Chris has written, but it would be activated on right click rather than always.

* In my own code I would use a QComboBox in this instance rather than a button.  I don't see what benefit the button gives, but I also don't care enough to press the point.
